column4: could someone help me i installed avant windows manager thru terminal that was made for gutsy not hardy ...and now i keep getting errors when i try to install avant thru the add/remove program

idoes anyone know what to do when u install someting the wrong way?/ i have hardy and i installed it this way could someone help me to uninstall it please http://linuxhelp.blogspot.com/2008/02/cool-awn-applets-to-adorn-your-ubuntu.html
sudo apt-get remove awn-core-applets-bzr and then remove the new entry from /etc/apt/sources.list
ok thanks man
ok it uninstalled but i still get errors when i try to install avant thru add/remove
what kind of errors?

cannot install avant window naviator this application conlficts with other installed software to install avant the confliction software must be removed first switch to synpatic pakcage manager to resolve this conflict
can you paste the exact message given by apt-get remove into a pastebin please?
i uninlstalled it sucessfully but when i go to add/remove it says other software is in the way and go to synaptic manager to resolve...its a pop and i cant copy and paste the words
i'm confused...what are you going to add/remove for if it was uninstalled successfully?
no i uninstalled thru terminal with sudo apt-get remove awn-core-applets-bzr
weird, it usually will tell you which software conflicts with it.  try what it says; go to synaptic, see if it shows a conflict there.
hw would i tell if theres a conflict there?
I would assume that a message would pop up or something :)
if nothing happens there, try running "sudo apt-get -f install" at command line
okay ima try
okay cool it told me to autoremove libawn-bzr so i did now ima see if that fixed it
SUCCESS THANK YOU MAN
awesome :)

it worked like a charm so now i know when i install something to sudo apt-get remove what i installed....is there a way of seeing extactly what i installed before it went wrong? god forbid i lost the site i was on and i needed to check whats conflicting with the program is there a way to find out cuz i run into this kinds of stuff alot
there's a way to show what's been installed already...i'll look it up, just a sec
dpkg --get-selections will show you all installed packages.  there may be a way to show them in date order but I don't know it.
awesome that'll help linux is getting so cool the hell with windows man
